TestGen-LLM.html: existing unit test class (UTC) + tested class id → ⟨CoverageAugmenting-Test-Extension⟩ → extended UTC.
TestGen-LLM.architectural_notes: Generated tests are further processed in a pipeline of filtering-analysis (e.g., buildability, non-flakiness, coverage improvement) that is part of the Assured LLM-Based Software Engineering [5] framework.

FSML.html: sig + meth-intent → ⟨MetamorphicAssertion-Characterization ⟩ → term-equiv assertions [Few-Shot, CoT: code intent + analysis].
FSML.architectural_notes:
Study on potential proficiency.
Study on potential proficiency.
Study on potential profi ciency.

ChatGPTTests.html: prgm → ⟨Test-Generation⟩ → test cases (basic); prgm + unit test cases (UTC) + cvrg report → ⟨CoverageAugmenting-Test-Extension⟩ → extended UTC.
ChatGPTTests.architectural_notes: Study. Two alternatives: (basic) and a version that tries to improve coverage.

CodeT.architectural_notes: It is part of a code generation approach that includes ulterior dual execution agreement to choose the best solution.

ChatUniTest.html: focal-class sig + focal meth src-code + required depend + sig meth → ⟨Test-Generation⟩ → (test) 1...5 [Adaptive focal ctxt]; test + error + focal meth + focal-class name + focal meth src-code → ⟨ErrorAware-Test-Correction⟩ → (test) 1...5 .
ChatUniTest.architectural_notes: Prompt is adaptive to token limit and further context of dependent classes could be added based on dependency graph. CoT is mentioned but not detailed. Repair phase may also leverage an LLM.

CodeCoT.html: funct def of unit + doc → ⟨Basic&Edge-TestCase-Generation⟩ → test cases.
CodeCoT.architectural_notes: Testing is part of a larger code generation solution.

AgentCoder.html: funct def of unit + doc → ⟨Basic&Edge-TestCase-Generation⟩ → test cases.
AgentCoder.architectural_notes: Testing is part of a larger code generation solution.

CodaMOSA.html: (portion) src-code under test + callable def + callable name → ⟨Targeted-Test-Generation⟩ → test cases.
CodaMOSA.architectural_notes: Use of LLMs in the context of Search-Based Software Testing. LLMs outputs require significant post-processing to be integrated into the SBST framework.

TestChain.html: func def of unit + doc → ⟨Basic&Edge-TestInput-Generation⟩ → inputs [One-Shot]; func def + doc + input → ⟨IntentionCorresponding-Result-Generation⟩ → (requested computation) ∗ + asserted value) [CoT, ReAct: request to compute the adequate output].
TestChain.architectural_notes: Designer agent and Calculator agents reported. Calculator uses Python Interpreter.

CoverUp.html: code excerpt + uncovered lines → ⟨CoverageAugmenting-Test-Generation⟩ → tests; code excerpt + test + uncovered lines + (errors) → ⟨CoverageAugmenting-Test-Correction⟩ → test.
CoverUp.architectural_notes: Uses testing framework including coverage tool.

TestPilot.html: meth under test sig + (doc) 0...1 + (usage examp) 0...1 + (src-code) 0...1 + (fail test + error) 0...1 → ⟨BuildablePassable-Test-Generation⟩ → (test) 0...5 .
TestPilot.architectural_notes: Refiner applies strategies to include or not certain info in prompts. Adaptive nature means that LLM is (re)invoked with failing test and error message if validation fails.

EASEeval.html: meth under test name + class code + import statements → ⟨Test-Generation⟩ → unit tests.

TELPA.html: MUT code + method-invocation seq + examp following m-i seq + branch-relevant meth → ⟨CoverageAugmenting-Test-Generation⟩ → test.
TELPA.architectural_notes: Static preprocessing is done to identify relevant method-invocation sequences and methods relevant for branch outcomes.

ChatTESTER.html: focal meth code → ⟨CodeCorresponding-Intent-Verbalization⟩ → intent; focal meth sig + intent → ⟨IntentCorresponding-Test-Generation⟩ → unit tests; unit test + error msgs → ⟨ErrorAware-Test-Correction⟩ → unit test.
ChatTESTER.architectural_notes: The iterative test refiner iteratively fixes the compilation errors in the tests generated by the initial test generation. This is done with parsing and analysis of components that build prompts.

DiffPrompt.html: snip → ⟨CodeCorresponding-Intent-Verbalization⟩ → intent; intent → ⟨IntentCorresponding-Code-Generation⟩ → prgms; prgm → ⟨Test-Generation⟩ → test cases.
DiffPrompt.architectural_notes: Single interaction for intent and program generation. Multiple interactions for obtaining test cases that have same result for all generated versions.

AID.html: problem description + code → ⟨IntentCorresponding-Code-Correction⟩ → code; problem description → ⟨ConstraintSatisfying-InputGenerator-Generation⟩ → code.
AID.architectural_notes: The approach includes differential testing to detect bugs.

secTests.html: funct name + client code + vul-id + vul API ids + reference test code → ⟨Mimicking-Test-Generation⟩ → test code on client code.
secTests.architectural_notes: Study on mimicking generic vulnerability-exploiting test given on client code.

SymPrompt.html: focal meth sig + type and dependency ctxt + path constr → ⟨ConstraintSatisfying-Input-Generation⟩ → test.
SymPrompt.architectural_notes: Preprocessing through static analysis techniques to get paths and context.

RESTGPT.html: OpenAPI spec → ⟨DescriptionCorresponding-Liberal-Constraint-Characterization⟩ → struct with constrs, types, format for params [Few-Shot]; OpenAPI spec + prev conv → ⟨ConstraintSatisfying-Input-Generation⟩ → examp for param [Few-Shot].
RESTGPT.architectural_notes: Improves the treatment of OpenAPI spec, particularly human-readable part. Both tasks are actually performed in a single prompt.

InputBlaster.html: local&global ctxt + NL candidate constrs + (dynamic hint) → ⟨GUIInputCorresponding-ValidityConstraint-Characterization⟩ → inferred constr [Few-Shot]; prev conv + inf constr → ⟨Valid-GUIInput-Generation⟩ → valid input + inferred constr [Few-Shot]; valid input + inferred constr + retrv examp of unusual bug-trigg inputs + (test-exec fdbk on mutant) → ⟨Effective&Diversified-MutationRule-Characterization⟩ → mutation rule [Few-Shot]; mutation rule + (test-exec fdbk on prev generator) → ⟨InputGenerator-Generation⟩ → test-input generator [Few-Shot].
InputBlaster.architectural_notes: Valid Input Generator (task 1 and 2) is iterated until it makes the APP transfer (elicited as a single prompt). Task 3 and 4 (also elicited in a single prompt) is also iterated and intermediate results are part of the feedback for effectiveness and diversity. DB is built with buggy examples from GitHUB recorded to match the style used in prompt. Also, unusual inputs that triggered crashes during execution of  on the APP. Similarly, it is used to select examples for in-Ctxt Learning.

PBT-GPT.html: API doc + focus meth name → ⟨Postcondition-Assertion-Generation⟩ → prop assertions; API doc + focus meth name → ⟨InputGenerator-Generation⟩ → gen funct; API doc + focus meth name + gen funct conv → ⟨ParametrizedTest-Generation⟩ → prop-based test; API doc + focus meth name → ⟨PropertyBasedTest-Generation⟩ → prop-based test.
PBT-GPT.architectural_notes: Three prompting strategies to generate property-based tests: independently (gen. funct. / property assertion), consecutively (continue conversation after gen. funct.), and together (single big-bang prompt).

mrDetector.html: shop name + shop type → ⟨LikelyRecalling-Data-Generation⟩ → searching keywords [Few-Shot, CoT]; shop name + shop type + potential recalling sentence → ⟨Answer-Quality(Reasonability)-Judgment⟩ → yes/no [Few-Shot].

MuTAP.html: prgm under test → ⟨Test-Generation⟩ → initial unit test (incl assert) [Zero-Shot/Few-Shot]; initial unit test + synt errors → ⟨ErrorAware-Test-Correction⟩ → unit test [Zero-Shot/Few-Shot]; prev conv + mutated code → ⟨AssertionObservable-Differential-Test-Generation⟩ → unit test.
MuTAP.architectural_notes: LLMs are invoked in a mutant-based test generation approach.

BugFarm.html: method signature + method body + statements to transform → ⟨BugInjecting-Code-Mutation⟩ → transformed code.
BugFarm.architectural_notes: LLM is used in the last of the 3 stages that includes method extraction, an a model’s attention to different parts of code to identify where to inject bugs.

\u00b5BERT.architectural_notes: Invoked to predict masked token. Stochasticity used to get 5 completions.

CHEMFUZZ.html: prev conv + masked-code → ⟨Valid&Diversified-Code-Completion⟩ → code; exec output → ⟨Behavior-Anomaly-Detection⟩ → eval report.
CHEMFUZZ.architectural_notes: LLM integrated into a fuzzing scheme.

FormAI.html: type of prgm + style → ⟨IntentCorresponding-Code-Generation⟩ → prgm.
FormAI.architectural_notes: Generation is the first phase for the construction of a labelled data set for vulnerability analysis.

LLMorpheus.html: source code fragment with placeholder + masked orig code → ⟨DifferentBehavior-Mutation-Generation⟩ → (replacement + brief explanation) + .

OSS-Fuzz.html: funct to tgt + project specific info → ⟨DriverCode-Generation⟩ → fuzz driver; funct to tgt + project specific info + compilation errors → ⟨ErrorAware-Driver-Code-Correction⟩ → fuzz driver.
OSS-Fuzz.architectural_notes: Part of a large project that includes introspection components and fuzzing ones. The description is a best effort from the on-line documentation.

ChatFuzz.architectural_notes: Use stochasticity to generate seeds in grey-box fuzzing workflow.

Fuzz4All.html: doc + (examp) ∗ + (specs) ∗ → ⟨Usage-Summarization ⟩ → distilled usage/funct; usage/funct → ⟨UsageSastifying-Input-Generation⟩ → fuzz inputs; usage/funct + input → ⟨SpecificationAware-Input-Mutation⟩ → mutated input; usage/funct + fuzz input → ⟨Input-Variation-Generation⟩ → fuzz input.
Fuzz4All.architectural_notes: Autoprompting distill user provided inputs. LLM-powered fuzzing loops which resort to generation, mutation and semantically equiv. variant generation. UGCTX [105] : Study of strategies. The two most sophisticated are reported.

UGCTX.html: header file + API usage examp + funct name → ⟨DriverCode-Generation⟩ → fuzz driver (); fuzz driver code + errors (compilation, link, run-time) + root cause API usage info → ⟨ErrorAware-DriverCode-Correction⟩ → fuzz driver (EX-ITER).

KernelGPT.html: operation handler code + usage op handl code → ⟨ CodeElements-Identification⟩ → device name + initialization op [Few-Shot] (Driver Detection); ioctl handl funct + assoc helper funct code + (fetched funct & types + prev inferred usage info) → ⟨ InfoRequesting-CodeElements-Identification⟩ → (command values) ∗ + (further required [functs,types] + usageInfo) [Few-Shot, Iterative Prompting: functs, types] (Command Value); argument to type + prev detected relevant funct code + argument’s usage + (fetched funct code) → ⟨ InfoRequesting-Type-Identification⟩ → argument type + further required (functs) [Few-Shot, Iterative Prompting: functs, types] (Argument Type); type to describe + src-code structs + (fetched snip) → ⟨ InfoRequesting-Definition-Extraction⟩ → type def + further required (nested type) [Iterative Prompting: nested types] (Type Definition); spec -made up identified elements- + errors → ⟨ErrorAware-Specification-Correction⟩ → spec [Few-Shot] (Specification Validation and Repair).
KernelGPT.architectural_notes: Syscall specification generation for enhancing fuzzing. A kernel code extractor feeds the LLM with the appropriate code snippets when requested. Refine and repair with feedback provided by external specification validation tool.

SearchGEM5.html: code → ⟨ParameterizedVersion-Code-Generation⟩ → param version + type of params [Few-Shot]; parameterized version + types → ⟨Valid-Input-Generation⟩ → input sample [Few-Shot]. WhiteFox [99] : expect input format + optimization name + src-code → ⟨ CodeReachability-Input-Characterization ⟩ → summ trigger input pattern [Few-Shot]; expected input format + input pattern → ⟨ConstraintSatisfying-Input-Generation⟩ → summ trigger input pattern [Few-Shot with feedback loop].
SearchGEM5.architectural_notes: Generates binary inputs for testing an HW-SW architecture simulator. That is, the tool also includes compilation, fuzzing and differential testing. LLM-tasks are elicited by in-chained prompts and a last prompt that requests the parameterized version, sample input and type.

FuzzingParsers.html: name object → ⟨ StructureOfObject-Recall ⟩ → well-formed tree structure; terminal name + (prev examples) → ⟨ New-ExampleOfThing-Recall ⟩ → example; name of parser → ⟨ ParsingErrors-Recall ⟩ → described parsing errors; string + error description → ⟨ErrorTriggering-Data-Variation-Generation⟩ → string; strings + type → ⟨Fuse-Transformation-Data⟩ → string.
FuzzingParsers.architectural_notes: These tasks belong to seed generation stage. Other stages include fuzzing and preprocessing. ChatAFL [63] : Multiple conversations with the LLM and majority vote for the final grammar. Interaction with editor to generate new seed. Interaction with completer to get message that would move protocol into a new state.

ChatAFL.html: protocol name → ⟨ ProtocolGrammar-Recall ⟩ → msg grammar [Few-Shot: expected format]; msg seq + desired additions → ⟨ModificationSpecified-MS-Edition⟩ → msg seq; comm history → ⟨Message-Completion⟩ → msg.

TitanFuzz.html: lib name + DL-API + expec tasks/intent → ⟨ IntentCorresponding-Code-Generation⟩ → code;
TitanFuzz.architectural_notes: Invoked in an evolutionary workflow to generate seeds and complete mutants.

FuzzGPT.html: code snip → ⟨APIUsed-Code-MultiClass-Classification⟩ → API label [Few-Shot]; name API to be used + code snip → ⟨ModificationSpecified-Code-Edition⟩ → code snip using API; API name → ⟨BugTriggering-Code-Generation⟩ → code [Few-Shot: classif snips, CoT: bug descrip]; API name + prtl code snip → ⟨BugRevealing-Code-Completion⟩ → code.
FuzzGPT.architectural_notes: Data Set (DS) preparation uses Classifier role. Then, random pick from DS and use alternative roles/strategies.

QTypist.html: input widget type + local ctxt + global ctxt → ⟨Input-Completion⟩ → generated input; masked input + local ctxt + global ctxt → ⟨Input-InFilling⟩ → generated input.
QTypist.architectural_notes: Prompts are generated by a set of rules on context information. Prompt-tuning is also in place. GPTDroid [58] : Tool builds prompts following linguistic patterns instantiated with extracted APP context information. Interaction follows question and answer style, which means in this case that when function being tested and status is yielded by the LLM, another question instructs LLM to yield next action. AXNav [82] : LLM-based UI navigation system to translate from natural language test instructions into a set of concrete steps, execute steps in the plan by calling APIs that interact with a device, and feedback results to the planner when needed.

GPTDroid.html: prev conv + GUI ctxt + prev action fdbk + functionality-aware memory → ⟨FunctionCoverageOriented-NextAction-Selection⟩ → funct being tested + status + next action [Few-Shot: to define output format]; action + new GUI ctxt + testing memory → ⟨Testing-Status-Analysis⟩ → testing status summary.

AXNav.html: accessibility test instruct + name of app under test + formatted UI element → ⟨TestGoalCorresponding-Plan-Generation⟩ → tentative plan = (task, action descr, justification, eval criteria, status) ∗ [CoT: justification] (planner); UI rep + test instruct → ⟨Plan-Refinement⟩ → concrete action [CoT: though, relevant UI ids, UI relevant elements] (mapper); test goal + tentative plan + concrete action + assoc thought + UI detections before + UI detections after + eval hints → ⟨PlannedAction-Successfullness-Assessment⟩ → eval criteria + result + explanation [CoT: eval criteria] (evaluator); test goal + tentative plan + current step + (field including a stop cond or eval error) → ⟨StepOutcomeCorresponding-Plan-Correction⟩ → updated tentative plan (replanner).

TARGET.html: traffic rule → ⟨DSLValid&TryToUseGivenElements-RuleConsistent-Scenario-Generation⟩ → draft scenario-rep [Few-Shot] (Know.Extract.); draft scenario-rep + rules → ⟨RuleInconsistencies-Scenario-Correction⟩ → scenario (Know.Val.); subcomponent scenario-rep + list of elements → ⟨InListCloseMeaning-Elements-Replacement⟩ → scenario (Syntax Alignm.).
TARGET.architectural_notes: Takes three phases to parse a traffic rule description to an executable driving scenario in a simulator. LLM addresses first processing phase. ScenarioNL [22] : ScenarioNL allows users to specify a model and prompting technique. Scenic database is used to store and retrieve semantically similar examples. SysKG-UTF [78] : LLMs play different roles in the construction and post-processing of a knowledge graph for exploratory testing.

ScenarioNL.html: crash incident report → ⟨Focused-Summarization⟩ → relevant dynamics + static objects [ToT: experts debate]; crash incident report + relevant objects → ⟨Ambiguity-Analysis⟩ → questions to disambiguate; crash incident report + question to disambiguate → ⟨ExpertSolvedUncertainty-TextDependent-QuestionAnswering⟩ → answers [ToT: experts debate]; relevant objects + properties → ⟨ProbabilisticProgram-Generation⟩ → Program (part) [Few-Shot + RAG or HyDE, Function Calling: GPL2DSL].
ScenarioNL.architectural_notes: allows users to specify a model and prompting technique. Scenic database is used to store and retrieve semantically similar examples.

SysKG-UTF.html: bug reports → ⟨ StructureCompliant-Information-Extraction ⟩ → preconds + steps to reprod (S2R) + obs behav + expect behav [Few-Shot]; S2R → ⟨StepsToReproduce-Refinement⟩ → (finer grained) S2R [Few-Shot]; bug scenario pair (incl S2R) → ⟨FeasibilityRedundancyAware-StepsToReproduce-Fusing(edition)⟩ → S2R [Few-Shot, CoT: pseudo-code guided interm assess]; bug scenario pair + potential (fused) S2R → ⟨FeasibilityAware-StepsToReproduce-Refinement⟩ → S2R [Few-Shot, CoT: assess].
SysKG-UTF.architectural_notes: LLMs play different roles in the construction and post-processing of a knowledge graph for exploratory testing.

PentestGPT.html: user-intents → ⟨IntentCorresponding-Plan-Generation ⟩ → penetration task tree (ptt) (1); testing results + ptt → ⟨Elements-Update⟩ → ptt (2); ptt + updated ptt → ⟨Validity-Transition-Analysis⟩ → result (3); ptt → ⟨RulesSatisfying-Information-Extraction⟩ → (potential next task) + (4); ptt + tasks → ⟨MostPromising-NextTask-Selection⟩ → sugg next task (5); sub-task + avail tools → ⟨ToolsConstrained-Plan-Generation⟩ → seq of steps [CoT] (6); step → ⟨Plan-Refinement⟩ → cmd [CoT] (7);
PentestGPT.architectural_notes: It incorporates three core modules: the Reasoning Module (1–5), the Generation Module (6,7), and the Parsing Module (8) (each reserving an LLM session). Active user feedback is possible.

pwn\u2019d.html: scenario → ⟨ScenarioCorresponding-Plan-Generation⟩ → pen-test plan [Agent GPT]; goal + prev conv + last cmd output → ⟨ReachabilityOriented-NextAction- Generation⟩ → cmd; cmd + output → ⟨Rationalized-VulnerabilityProneness-CommandExecution-Mul- tiLabel-Classification⟩ → potential vul.
pwn\u2019d.architectural_notes: High-level task planning uses mechanisms to integrate LLMs as agents (AutoGPT). Low-level vector attack works as a step by step reactive execution of plan.

SELF-DEBUGGING.html: code snippet + code snippet + input + feedback → ⟨Differences-RootCause-Analysis⟩ → execution-based analysis [Few-Shot, CoT: trace execution ] (C++-TO-PYTHON).
SELF-DEBUGGING.architectural_notes:
For the Generation step, given the problem description, the model predicts candidate programs (not shown in this report). Explanation step, the model is prompted to process the predictions in a “semantically useful way”, such as explaining the prediction (and reference NL query for SQL query generation, source program for translation program) in natural language. Correctness is then predicted by different tasks depending on the code generation/translation problem. Here we show how this can be determined by asking the model itself to work as oracle of correctness. Generation, explanation, evaluation and repair are chained in demonstrations.
For the Generation step, given the problem description, the model predicts candidate programs (not shown in this report). The fault detection is performed by creating an execution trace of the predicted code for a sample input.

TOGLL.html: test prefix + MUT code + MUT doc → ⟨Assertion-Generation⟩ → assertion.
TOGLL.architectural_notes: Six different prompts are studied. We report one with the richest context (P6).

Eywa.html: funct defs + arguments + result + validity constraints → ⟨ProtocolModelImplementation-Generation⟩ → model code.
Eywa.architectural_notes: LLM is used to generate protocol model code. Symbolic execution is further used to generate test cases.-

PropertyGPT.html: base rule code + funct code under test + contract src-code → ⟨Similar-Assertion-Generation⟩ → rule code [RAG: base rule code]; base pre/post + funct under test → ⟨Similar-Assertion-Generation⟩ → funct- level pre/post [RAG: base pre/post]; rule code + contract src-code + error info + funct under test name → ⟨ ErrorAware-Assertion-Correction⟩ → rule code; rule code + contract src-code + base rule code + missing funct under test name → ⟨MissingFunction-Assertion-Correction⟩ → rule code.
PropertyGPT.architectural_notes: Uses Retrieval augmented generation by providing relevant specifications to be based on.

ClarifyGPT.html: MUT sig + doc → ⟨IntentCorresponding-Code-Generation⟩ → (code) ∗ ; MUT sig + doc → ⟨Basic&Edge-TestInput-Generation⟩ → (test) + [Few-Shot]; req + (code of alt sol) + → ⟨CodeDifferences-Verbalization⟩ → descr and diffs [Few-Shot]; req + alt sol descr and diffs → ⟨Ambiguity-Analysis⟩ → clarifying questions [Few-Shot].
ClarifyGPT.architectural_notes: Intention clarification is part of this code generation approach. Generated inputs (and mutations) are used to cluster solutions. Differences analysis and clarifying questions are actually performed by a single prompt.

CEDAR.html: focal meth + unit-test snip → ⟨Assertion-Generation⟩ → assert [Few-Shot + RAG: retrv demo (U-Test snip)].
CEDAR.architectural_notes: General demonstration retrieval method illustrated in assertion generation. Neural and frequency-based techniques for retrieval.

EMR.html: req doc → ⟨ IORelated-Sentences-Identification⟩ → I/O sentences; I/O sentences → ⟨SentenceDerivable-MethamorpicRelation-Characterization⟩ → metamorphic relation (MR); MR + SUT API + SUT docum → ⟨RequirementsDerivable-ExecutionMethamor- picRelations-Generation⟩ → executable metamorphic relations [Few-Shot: DSL].
EMR.architectural_notes: Initial study on generating metamorphic relations from documentation and executable metamorphic relations. Some details on prompt engineering are not provided and are conjectural.

GameBugDescriptions.html: video game name + scenario + perspective (e.g. game designer, player, real-world) → ⟨Scenario-AccordingToPerspective- Anomaly-Detection⟩ → thought; prev conv → ⟨Answer-FailureOriented-Summarization ⟩ → buggy event (Answer Extraction).

MetaMorph.html: doc snip → ⟨ VariableNames-Identification⟩ → vars [Few- Shot].

ALGO.html: prob formul + in/out examp → ⟨BruteForce-IntentCorrespond- ing-Code-Generation⟩ → implem.
ALGO.architectural_notes: This (oracle synthesis) is part of a program generation framework. Program generation may use implicit or explicit search (e.g., algorithmic ideas).

AdbGPT.html: bug report → ⟨ StepsToReproduce-Extraction⟩ → steps to reprod [Few-Shot, CoT]; view hierarchy of the GUI + step → ⟨Plan-Refinement⟩ → component to operate [Few-Shot, CoT]. CrashTranslator [37] : manifested page names + curr page + crash page → ⟨ ReachabilityOriented-NextNode-Selection⟩ → next page [Zero-Shot, LLM fine-tuned with APPs transition relations]; manifested page names + current page + crash page + next page + interactible widgets → ⟨ReachabilityOrientedWithSuggestedNextNode-NextAction-Selection⟩ → widget [Zero-Shot, LLM fine-tuned with targeted GUI page and transfer widget].

LIBRO.html: bug report + (stack trace) 0...1 → ⟨BugReproducing-Test- Generation⟩ → test meth [Few-Shot].
LIBRO.architectural_notes: LLM works as first component of tool chain. A set of test candidates are generated by querying the LLM multiple times.

Cupid.html: bug report → ⟨ AimedAtDuplicateDetection-Keywords-Extraction ⟩ → keywords.
Cupid.architectural_notes: LLM plays a punctual role into a traditional solution for duplicate bug report.

AutoFL.html: failing test info → ⟨RootCause-Analysis⟩ → root cause [ReAct: funct calls for debugging]; prev conv → ⟨Answer-FaultOriented-Summarization⟩ → culprit.
AutoFL.architectural_notes: Two stages: root cause explanation and bug location. LLM uses function calling.

AutoSD.html: funct meth + tests + err msg + (reports) 0...1 → ⟨RootCause- Analysis⟩ → hypoth + prediction + experiment; hypoth + predict + experiment + exp observation → ⟨EvidenceSupport- Judgment⟩ → conclusion; prev conv → ⟨DebuggingAware-Code-Generation⟩ → fixed code.
AutoSD.architectural_notes: Chained interaction of LLMs with executing engines.

LLM4CBI.html: prgm + mutation instr + validity fdbk → ⟨MutationSpecified- Code-Mutation⟩ → prgm.
LLM4CBI.architectural_notes: Generation of prompts uses ad-hoc static analysis. Then they are selected, executed and modified in a RL workflow that includes some classic localization techniques.

ChatGPT-4(Log).html: focal source faulty code → ⟨FaultProneness-Code- Lines-Ranking⟩ → ordered list of lines and reason [CoT: funct intent , reason per line]; prev conv + test case + error → ⟨TestResultAware-FaultProneness-CodeLines- ReRanking⟩ → intent + ordered list of lines and reason.
ChatGPT-4(Log).architectural_notes: Empirical study of LLMs proficiency. Code context is modified in the controlled experiment to assess impact.

RCACopilot.html: diagnostic info → ⟨RootCauseOriented-Summarization ⟩ → summ diag (incident summarization); incident summ + list close categorized historic incidents → ⟨ Common-Root- Cause-Selection⟩ → root cause + category [CoT: explanation].
RCACopilot.architectural_notes: Diagnostic information collection stage is performed before prediction. Tasks are core part of larger solution.

x-lifecycle.html: service descr → ⟨RootCauseOriented-Summarization ⟩ → summ svc descr;
x-lifecycle.architectural_notes: Vector data base is used for Retrieval Augmented Generation.

RCAAgents.html: initial incident info → ⟨RootCause-Analysis⟩ → root cause [ReAct: rqst for details, rqst for historical inc, query on retrieved inc]; retrv text + query → ⟨TextDependent-QuestionAnswering⟩ → answer.
RCAAgents.architectural_notes: Vector data base to search for historical incidents.

LM-PACE.html: (incident, root cause) + + curr incident + (guessed root cause) → ⟨SufficiencyToInferAnswer-Assessment⟩ → analysis; prev conv → ⟨Assessment-Yes/No-Summarization⟩ → yes/no (1); relevant-incids with root causes + curr incid + answ root cause → ⟨Answer- Qlty(Truth, Ground, Informative)-Assessment⟩ → analysis;
LM-PACE.architectural_notes: Focus on confidence estimation and calibration. Root cause generation is a black box that can be addressed by LLMs as well. Relevant incidents came from historical-DB (semantic similarity-based retriever). Confidence of Evaluation (COE-score) and Root-Cause-Evaluation (RCE-score) are obtained from (1) and (2) resp. multiple sampling on LLMs. COE and RCE scores are the input of an optimization procedure to build a model to predict calibrated confidence score. In deployment phase, predicted root cause and calibrated confidence score is yield to on-call engineers. inContextRCA [110] : Vector data base is populated with summarized incidents and root causes.

inContextRCA.html: report → ⟨RootCauseOriented-Summarization⟩ → incident + root cause; incident report → ⟨RootCause-Analysis⟩ → root cause [Few-Shot: similar examples].

ChatGPT4vul.html: src-code → ⟨VulnerabilityProneness-Code-OneClass- Classification⟩ → yes/no; prev conv → ⟨VulnerabilityProneness-CodeLines-Ranking⟩ → list; src-code + (tgt CWD-ID) + → ⟨ListTargeted-CWEVulnerabilityProneness-Code- MultiLabel-Classification⟩ → CWD-ID; src-code → ⟨CVSS-Scoring⟩ → score.
ChatGPT4vul.architectural_notes: Study of profi- ciency. It includes repair prompts (not reported here).

VulBench.html: snip + (vul classes) 0...1 → ⟨Rationalized-ListTargeted-CWE- VulnerabilityProneness-Code-MultiLabel-Classification⟩ → vul verdict + (vul class) 0...1 + step by step explanation [Few-Shot: ∈ project — ∉ project, CoT].
VulBench.architectural_notes: Study including alter- native prompting strategies.

NLBSE24.html: code snippet → ⟨VulnerabilityProneness-Code-OneClass- Classification⟩ → yes/no; code snippet + intended functionality → ⟨GivenIntentionCorrespondence-Code- OneClass-Classification⟩ → yes/no.
NLBSE24.architectural_notes: This evaluation also in- cludes tasks versions that take previous labels as inputs.

VulDetect.html: tgt code snippet → ⟨Rationalized-CWEVulnerabilityProne- ness-Code-MultiLabel-Classification⟩ → yes/no + vul type + vul name + explanation; tgt code snip + tgt CWE → ⟨Rationalized-ListTargeted-CWEVulnerabilityProne- ness-Code-MultiLabel-Classification⟩ → yes/no + vul type + vul name + explanation; tgt code snip + CWE-DF → ⟨Rationalized-DataFlowTargeted-CWEVulnerabil i- tyProneness-Code-MultiLabel-Classification⟩ → yes/no + vul type + vul name + data-flow explanation; query + data-flow-analysis → ⟨Answer-Quality-Assessment⟩ → yes/no + ex- planation + final verdict.
VulDetect.architectural_notes: Study including al ternative prompting strategies. Self-reflection is one option.

GRACE.html: code snippet + code property graph → ⟨CPGEnhanced-Vulner- abilityProneness-Code-OneClass-Classification⟩ → yes/no [Few-Shot: retrieved demonstration].
GRACE.architectural_notes: We report the enhanced vulnerability detection module. The approach also consist in a demonstration selection module and a graph structure information generation module.

VSP.html: src-code → ⟨Rationalized-CWEVulnerabilityProneness-Code-MultiL- abel-Classification⟩ → list CWEs [Few-Shot, CoT]; src-code + CWE id → ⟨Rationalized-IdTargeted-CWEVulnerabilityProneness- Code-OneClass-Classification⟩ → yes/no + reason [Few-Shot, CoT]. AIagent [75]: (vul type name + caveat) + + src-code → ⟨ListTargeted-CWE- VulnerabilityProneness-CodeLine-MultiClass-Classification⟩ → result (category

DLAP.html: code-snippet + (snippet + label + probability) + → ⟨ GivenExamples-VulnerabilityProneness-Code-MultiLabel-Soft-Classification ⟩ → label + prediction (Super ICL); guidance steps + code to review + potential vulnerability → ⟨Plan-Refinement⟩ → specific review-steps (Bespoke CoT Guidance); code + prob prediction + specific review-steps → ⟨Rationalized-Re- viewStepsEnhanced-IdTargeted-CWEVulnerabilityProneness-Code-OneClass- Soft-Classification⟩ → vulnerability+prob+reason [CoT: reason] (Final Prompt).
DLAP.architectural_notes: DL models are used to generate a prediction probability that serve as reference input for LLM assessment. LHS is used to find similar code. Static analysis results are key to query to obtain customized CoT generation guidance templates.

MultiTask.html: code snippet → ⟨VulnerabilityProneness-Code-OneClass- Classification⟩ → yes/no (Detection); code snippet → ⟨CVSS-Scoring⟩ → score (Assessment); code snippet → ⟨VulnerabilityProneness-CodeLine-OneClass-Classification ⟩ → lines (Location); code snippet → ⟨CWE-VulnerabilityProneness-Code-MultiLabel-Classification ⟩ → (CWE + description) ∗ (Description).

PromptEnhanced.html: src-code → ⟨CodeCorresponding-Intent- Verbalization⟩ → intent; src-code + intent + (API call seq) + (data-flow descr) → ⟨ (APICalls)/(DataFlow)Enhanced-VulnerabilityProneness-Code-OneClass- Classification⟩ → yes/no.
PromptEnhanced.architectural_notes: Study on different prompting strategies. It actually tries unsuccessfully to generate data-flow and API calls by using LLM too (property characterization, in our terms).

ChatGPT(Plus).html: project info + ext src knowl (top CWE) + src-code to analyze → ⟨(CWE+GivenVulnDescr)VulnerabilityPronenes s -Code-OneClass- Classification⟩ → yes/no [Few-Shot: K-examp either (random)/Few-Shot + AG: simil code to analyze].
ChatGPT(Plus).architectural_notes: Study of profi- ciency of GPTs vs fine-tuned version.

FLAG.html: prefix snippet + (suffix snippet) + (prefix of line to be guessed) → ⟨ContextConsistent-Line-Completion⟩ → code line. EditTime [8]: → ⟨ Definition-Recall ⟩ → vul task descrip; code language + vul type → ⟨ Example-Recall ⟩ → examp; code snip → ⟨Rationalized-VulnerabilityProneness-Code-OneClass-Classification ⟩ → yes/no + explan; code snip → ⟨Rationalized-VulnerabilityProneness-Code-OneClass-Classification ⟩ → yes/no + explan [Few-Shot: recalled examp].
FLAG.architectural_notes: LLM is used as line genera- tor (preprocessor). A bounded number of attempts with hints is tried to get non empty line. Feature extraction based on edit distances and Bleu. Logprobs of tokens are used when available. Classification is done based on such features.

WitheredLeaf.html: code → ⟨Rationalized-SemanticBugPresence-CodeLine- OneClass-Classification⟩ → yes/no + (line + reason) + ; (code line + reason) + → ⟨Warnings-Irrelevance-Filtering⟩ → (line + reason) + ; code line + reason → ⟨Rationalized-BugFixabilityByNameChange-CodeLine- OneClass-Classificatio n⟩ → yes/no + fixed-line [CoT: fi x]; prev conv + code line + reason → ⟨ListSemiTargeted-BugCategory-BugExpla- nation-MultiClass-Classification⟩ → category.
WitheredLeaf.architectural_notes: Lightweight, open- source models (e.g., infilling ones) are used to identify suspicious program entities as a preprocessing step. Last tasks are implemented by same prompt.

LLMAPIDet.html: code before + code after → ⟨RootCauseOriented-Change- Action-Verbalization⟩ → rule [Few-Shot]; code snip (incl. API usage) → ⟨CodeCorresponding-Intent-Generation⟩ → NL description; code snip + API usage + (potential misuses rules) → ⟨ GivenAPIMisuseRulesCompliance-Code-OneClass-Classification⟩ → yes/no [RAG].
LLMAPIDet.architectural_notes: Study on DL API Misuse Root Causes that feed LLM-based solution. Misuse rules populates a DB and examples for misuses detection. Potential misuse rule list by cosine similarity between the code explanation obtained in step 2 and each misuse rule in DB. Patching step is not shown in this report.

ChatGPTSCV.html: src smrt contrct + tgt vuls → ⟨Rationalized-ListTar- geted-CWEVulnerabilityProneness-Code-MultiLabel-Classification⟩ → assessment [CoT]; vul classes + assess → ⟨AssessmentBased-Vulnerability-MultiClass- Summarization⟩ → list (vul class, DerivedBinaryVerdict) [CoT].

SmartAudit.html: contract src-code + vul type + vul descr → ⟨ListTargeted- CWEVulnerabilityProneness-Code-OneClass-Classification⟩ → yes/no; contract src-code → ⟨Rationalized-VulnerabilityProneness-Code-MultiLabel- Classification⟩ → vuls descr; contract src-code + prev conv + (focal funct name) → ⟨Rationalized-Vulner abilityProneness-Code-MultiLabel-Classification⟩ → vuls descr + (fix recom) [CoT: intent + thoughts].
SmartAudit.architectural_notes: Potentiality study of LLMs to find smart contract vulnerabilities. Binary, non-binary, CoT prompts are presented. CoT version is performed by iteratively asking LLM to audit each function name, revisiting audit or linking functions to find vulnerabilities.

GPTLens.html: src-code → ⟨Rationalized-VulnerabilityProneness-Code-MultiL abel-Classification⟩ → (vul + funct name + reason) ∗ (auditor); src-code + vul + funct name + reason → ⟨Audits-Qlty(Correctness, Severity, Profitability)-Assessment⟩ → score + explan (critic).
GPTLens.architectural_notes: Several auditors solv- ing detection task generate potential vulnerabilities. A critic assess them.

LLM4Vuln.html: vul report + tgt code → ⟨CodeCorresponding-Intent- Verbalization⟩ → operational summary (funct.summ.); vul report → ⟨Vulnerability-MechanismExplanation-Summarization ⟩ → abstract vul (abs.gen.); tgt code + (DB.MatchVulReport(TC)) (Alt1) + (DB.MatchAbsVulKnow(funct.summ.(TC)) (Alt2) → ⟨InfoRequesting- Rationalized-GivenVulnDescrProneness-Code-MultiLabel-Classification ⟩ → yes/no + (type of vul), (reason) [Pre-CoT: functional summary + explicit errors — Post-CoT: patch or Proof of Concept exploit , ReAct: getFunc- tionDefinition, getClassInheritance, getVariableDefinition, RAG: Alt1,
LLM4Vuln.architectural_notes: Evaluation framework that includes LLM-based Result Annotation and Analysis (not reported here). Vector DB are populated using abstract-generation and functionalsummary to match in analysis time relevant summarized vulnerability knowledge (Alt2). aw version is based on a DB matching reports to vulnerable code (Alt1). LLM seeks extra context through LLM’s function calling mechanism.

GPTScan.html: (scenario) ∗ + contract src-code → ⟨ GivenCharacteristicsCorrespondenc e -Code-OneClass-Classificatio n ⟩ → yes/no [CoT: mimic in the background] (1); scenario + prop + contract src-code → ⟨GivenBehaviorCorrespondence-Code- OneClass-Classification⟩ → yes/no [CoT: mimic in the background]; src-code → ⟨ RoleBased-CodeElements-Identification⟩ → vars/statements [CoT: mimic in the background].
GPTScan.architectural_notes: Authors break down common logic vulnerability types into scenarios and properties. LLMs scenario and property matches and identified variables are validated by static confirmation. Saving on GPT costs by first filtering in a single prompt (1).

CFG-Chain.html: code → ⟨ CodeBlocks-Extraction⟩ → nested code-blocks [Few-Shot]; code + nstd code-blocks → ⟨ BlockCorresponding-Code-Extraction⟩ → basic code-blocks [Few-Shot]; code-block → ⟨ControlFlow-Identification⟩ → CFG [Few-Shot]; CFGs → ⟨CFG-Fusion⟩ → CFG [Few-Shot].
CFG-Chain.architectural_notes: LLMs are invoked in a chain of subtasks: structure hierarchy extraction (translation), nested block extraction (completer), Basic code CFG (translation) and graph fusion.

LLift.html: use site + (retrv code snip) → ⟨ InfoRequesting-Initializator- Identification⟩ → (retrv rqst) + initializer [ReAct: funct to retrv]; use site + init sig → ⟨PostConstraint-Identification⟩ → post-constr on init results [ Self-Validation ]; init invoc + post-constr + var focus → ⟨InfoRequesting-QualifiedPostCondi- tion-Characterization⟩ → (retrv rqst) + may-must init-post [Few-Shot, CoT, ReAct, Self-Validation ].
LLift.architectural_notes: Post-constraint guided path analysis to verify the path feasibility of the “use” of an initialized variable. Static analyzer upstream; two conversations ((1) init detect./post-constraint generation (2) summarization): multiple iterations each. Majority voting.

SkipAnalyzer.html: code snip → ⟨Rationalized-NullDerreferencePresence-Code- OneClass-Classification⟩ → yes/no + vul descr [CoT, One-Shot, Few-Shot]; code snip → ⟨Rationalized-ResourceLeakPresence-Code-OneClass-Classification ⟩ → yes/no + vul descr [CoT, One-Shot, Few-Shot]; code snip + warning → ⟨Warning-FalsePositiveProneness-Assessment⟩ → verdict [CoT, One-Shot, Few-Shot].
SkipAnalyzer.architectural_notes: The pipeline analyzes snippets by using LLMs and static analysis tools like Infer. LLM is also used to filter false-positive warnings. LLMs are used to fix code as well (out of scope).

InferROI.html: snip → ⟨ ResourceLeakRelated-CodeElements-Identification ⟩ → leakable resources + acquisition/releasing calls + closed if-conds.
InferROI.architectural_notes: LLM is used to get intentions in code, then a static resource leak detection engine is feed with this information.

LLMDFA.html: AST-traversal skel + (suggested identif rules) → ⟨Source/Sink- ElementIdentificationCode-Completion⟩ → source/sink extractor [Few-Shot: E spec ]; AST-traversal skel + suggested identif rules + E spec + prev candidate extractor script + (error msg on E spec ) + (false pos on E spec ) + (false neg on E spec ) → ⟨Source/Sink-ElementIdentificationCode-Correction⟩ → candidate extractor; code snip + ¡var, line¿ + ¡var, line¿ → ⟨VariablesSameValue-Identification⟩ → yes/no [CoT, Few-Shot: incl though]; script skeleton + path information → ⟨PathConditionEncoding-Code- Completion⟩ → candidate script; script skeleton + path information + prev candidate script + error msgs → ⟨ PathConditionEncoding-Code-Correction⟩ → candidate script.
LLMDFA.architectural_notes: LLMs are used together with solvers, parser and ad-hoc code.

E&V.html: task input + static-analysis pseudo-code + relevant src-code + prev results + verif fdbk → ⟨Step-Computation⟩ → round output + (retrv-rqst) 0...1 ; exec specs + relev src-code + pesudo-code + round output → ⟨Behavior-Cor- rectness-Assessment⟩ → verif fdbk. LATTE [55]: name + (code) 0...1 → ⟨ Sink-Identification⟩ → sink; name + (code) 0...1 → ⟨ ExternalInputSource-Identification⟩ → external input source; (prev conv) + code snip + taint srcs + taint info → ⟨TaintFlow-Identification ⟩ → deduced data flow [incr prompt seq]; prompt seq results → ⟨Rationalized-TaintFlowAnalysisEnhanced-CWEVulnerabil- ityProneness-Code-MultiLabel-Classification⟩ → (vul) + .
E&V.architectural_notes: General framework for conducting static analysis from pseudo-code by means of LLMs. Agent-based architecture, but hard-coded planning strategies. Augment temperature if re-analysis required.

SimulinkSlicer.html: model + requirement → ⟨ Model-Slicing⟩ → model components [Few-Shot, CoT: dependence chain elicitation by demonstration].

CORE.architectural_notes: Proposer LLM generates potential code revisions (not shown here). Static analysis is run on those revisions. Reviewer ranks solutions for specific fix warnings.

AlloyRepair.html: faulty spec + (generic-feedback) 0...1 → ⟨FeedbackGuided- Specification-Correction⟩ → fixed spec (repair agent); faulty spec + suggestion → ⟨SuggestionGuided-Specification-Correction⟩ → fixed spec (repair agent); report feedback + faulty spec → ⟨Suggestion-Generation⟩ → suggestion (prompt agent).
AlloyRepair.architectural_notes: Alloy analyzer is used to validate an generate a report that is either used as input for correction or processed by an LLM to generate a efined suggestion.

ChatInv.html: code + loc + masked assert → ⟨Assertion-Completion⟩ → assert [InFiller].

Loopy.html: annot prgm with prop to be verif → ⟨ Inductive&SufficientLoopInvariant-Assertion-Generation⟩ → prgm an- not with set of loop assert; annot prgm + verif fdbk → ⟨SyntaxInductivenessSufficiency Aw ar e -Assertion- Correction⟩ → annot prgm.
Loopy.architectural_notes: Invariants are checked by using symbolic tools. Assertions collected trough several LLM invocations. Then it checks (in linear time) if there exists a subset that is inductive and sufficient. Repair takes into account categorized feedback and dependence relation between assertions.

SpecGen.html: prgm → ⟨CodeCorresponding-Specification-Generation⟩ → prgm with specs [Few-Shot]; prev conv + curated verif fdbk → ⟨ErrorAware-Specification-Correction⟩ → prgm with specs [Few-Shot].
SpecGen.architectural_notes: Tasks models first phase of the approach: a conversation-driven specification generation leveraging LLMs.

Dafny-Synth.html: intent → ⟨IntentCorresponding-AnnotatedCode-Generation⟩ → annot code (contextless); intent + sig + tests → ⟨Intent&TestsCorresponding-AnnotatedCode-Generation⟩ → annot code (signature); intent → ⟨IntentCorresponding-Signature-Generation⟩ → sig (dynamic); intent + sig → ⟨NL-Specification-Distillation⟩ → pre/post spec (dynamic); intent + sig + spec → ⟨Intent&SignatureCorresponding-Provable-Annotated- Code-Generation⟩ → anno code [RAG + Few-Shot: retrieved simil] (dynamic).

Clover.html: annot code skel + verifier fdbk → ⟨VerifierAware-AnnotationCor- responding-Code-InFilling⟩ → code (anno2code); annot code skel + compiler fdbk → ⟨CompilerAware-AnnotationCorresponding- Code-InFilling⟩ → code (anno-complete); intent + annot code skel + compiler fdbk → ⟨IntentCorresponding-Code- InFilling⟩ → code (doc2code); annot code → ⟨CodeCorresponding-Intent-Verbalization⟩ → docstrings (code2doc); code → ⟨HoareValid-Annotation-Completion⟩ → pre/postcond (code2anno); funct sig with docstring + comp fdbk → ⟨IntentCorresponding-PrePost- Formalization⟩ → annot code with pre and post (doc2anno); annotation → ⟨AnnotationCorresponding-Intent-Verbalization⟩ → docstrings (anno2doc); docstring + docstring → ⟨Docstrings-Equivalence-Checking⟩ → yes/no (doc- string equiv check).
Clover.architectural_notes: Consistency checks to know (i) the code is functionally correct with respect to its annotation; (ii) the annotation captures the full functionality of the code; and (iii) the DocString also accurately reflects the functionality of the code. Deductive checker and tests are used to prove annotated programs and equivalence between reconstructed artifacts.

AutoSpec.architectural_notes: Call graph is used to identify locations and order for specification generation.

Lemur.html: code under analysis + place holder → ⟨Invariant-Lemma- Generation⟩ → assert; code under analysis + place holder + assert + issue → ⟨Invariant-Lemma- Correction⟩ → assert.
Lemur.architectural_notes: Integrated with verifiers, it follows a set of proof rules that invokes LLMs to act as suggesters of auxiliary assertions and repairer of those suggestions.

RustProof.html: annot code (with precond) → ⟨PostCondition-Generation ⟩ → annot code (with pre/post) [CoT: code intent + precond explan ]; annot src-code sgmnt → ⟨Invariant-Lemma-Generation⟩ → sgmnt-with-proof [Few-Shot, CoT: precond explan + postcond explan + inv explan + proof explan]; annot src-code sgmnt + last answer + model checker error → ⟨ErrorAware- Lemma-Correction⟩ → sgmnt-with-proof [CoT].
RustProof.architectural_notes: Proof helper in- tegrated with smart contract model checker. Human and static analysis tools can be integrated to improve generation.
